attributes.action: give us a dafodil in the Supreme Court emblem
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Where is Wales in the Supreme Court emblem?

The new Supreme Court of the United Kingdom, at no doubt vast expense has a new emblem. We have flowers for Ireland, Scotland and England but Wales is represented by a few random bits of greenery supposedly a leek. I want a daffodil!

What's wrong with the daffodil? If they wanted to use flowers for a badge we have a perfectly respectable flower that would be instantly recognisable and improve the symmetry. If they insist that the leek is our national symbol then give us a proper leek not bits of leaf curled around and English rose.
I think we should demand the daffodil what a silly way to alienate a nation from a new national institution, especially one which is desperately proud of the money it has spent on curtains and carpets this year.

rejection.details: This is a devolved matter and should be directed to the Welsh Assembly.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
